turn.0: ELI5: Why was Harvey Weinstein convicted and sentenced to 23 years in prison?
turn.1: >disregard logic for feelings.  anyone who thinks that a man with 40 years of credible allegations against him, was convicted based on a rumor, has disregarded logic for feelings.
turn.2: >anyone who thinks that a man with 40 years of **credible** allegations against him  well isn't that the question? Whether the allegations were credible?
turn.3: >isn't that the question? Whether the allegations were credible?  yes, that is the question that was answered during the trial.
turn.4: And I'm asking WHY they were answered that way. You are using a circular argument - he's guilty because he's lying, he's lying because he's guilty.
turn.5: > You are using a circular argument - he's guilty because he's lying  I never said anything about him lying, so I don't think you're even really able to comprehend the point I made and I don't know why anyone would waste any time engaging in good-faith from that point
